snippet: To the Editor:    ''Land of Religious Freedom Has Universe of Spirituality'' (front page, March 30) says that the Heaven's Gate sect ''was notable mainly for its violent end.'' Yet in their end, the members of Heaven's Gate neither perpetrated nor...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''Land of Religious Freedom Has Universe of Spirituality'' (front page, March 30) says that the Heaven's Gate sect ''was notable mainly for its violent end.'' Yet in their end, the members of Heaven's Gate neither perpetrated nor received in their bodies any acts of violence. They calmly and apparently willingly and with great hope ended their lives. Their end might be described as tragic, but it was certainly not violent. PAUL KENT OAKLEY Somerset, N.J., March 30, 1997
abstract: Paul Kent Oakley letter disputes assertions in March 30 article that mass suicides of 39 members of Heaven's Gate cult in California were violent (S)

headline.kicker: Cultists' Deaths Call Our Insight Into Question
